Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different types of habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can make detailed observations and include at least two different types of living things (plants or animals) in each habitat drawing.
The student can show differences in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats.
The student can use the drawings to illustrate patterns in the types of living things found in different habitats (e.g., trees and squirrels in a forest, fish and weeds in a pond).
The student can organize their drawings in a way that clearly compares the two habitats and the living things within them.
